brief: to turn aside, to take away
long: Meaning: to "turn" off (literally or figuratively).  Usage: be(-head), bring, call back, decline, depart, eschew, get (you), go (aside), × grievous, lay away (by), leave undone, be past, pluck away, put (away, down), rebel, remove (to and fro), revolt, × be sour, take (away, off), turn (aside, away, in), withdraw, be without.  Source: or "שׂוּר"; (Hosea 9:12), a primitive root;
